name: Chris San Buenaventura
text: Not saying first world countries don't have poor people. But the definition, the state of living and the sheer number of the poor are magnitudes apart between the two worlds. And with this difference, I believe we should not assume that the same policy and policing strategies would effect the same result. How can you, if a simple rule is broken by 80% of the population in one place and a mere 20% on another (i.e. littering).
